record.dc:title: 186BY13 Ledford Island, Bradley County, Tennessee. Burial 16BY171, an adult female below with femora having been removed and placed on 16BY170, a mature male lying across it. In the background is 16BY172, an infant skull. Square 14R13. Direction South.
record.wpa:narrative: [16BY170] Mature male in fair condition, extended on back with head to SW. (Frontal bone broken during excavation). Buried intrusive to burial below. Femurs of 16BY171 at datum depth 7.4. Skull lying on occipital. [16BY171] Adult female in fair condition, extended on back with head to NW. 16BY170 more recent, obviously pit for 170 burial goes through 171 at femurs. Left femur of 171 on top of left radius of 170. Right femur of 171 lying across left femur and pelvis of 170. Skull of 171 crushed and turned slightly to west. Skull lying on occipital. [16BY172] Indeterminate infant in fair condition, extended on back with head to NW. Top of skull only, lying on occipital. Decomposition rather than disturbance seems to be the reason for the absence of the long bones.
